thread.title: Video: USU Aggies take drivers' seat in Mountain West
thread.title_full: Video: USU Aggies take drivers' seat in Mountain West | Deseret News

title: Video: USU Aggies take drivers' seat in Mountain West
text:
Utah State football coach Matt Wells described the victory as “maybe the greatest win in this program’s history.”
Upcoming Games USU Football USU   USU @ SDSU Qualcomm Stadium, San Diego Oct. 23, 8:30 p.m. 6  Days   7  Hrs   57  Mins   9  Secs More Coverage Saturday Morning QB: Stars and stats from Utah State's shock over No. 21 Boise State Utah State report card: Defense is strong against Boise State LOGAN — The 12-game losing streak to Boise State is over. In fact, the losing streak was shredding to pieces as the Aggies stormed over the Broncos with a massive 52-26 victory in Maverik Stadium Friday night.
As far as the stats go, the Aggies and the Broncos were relatively close — until you look at the turnovers. Utah State recorded eight turnovers in the victory, and according to head coach Matt Wells, that’s what made the difference.
There was only one thing Wells was upset with after the game: having to decide who deserved the game footballs. Wells described the game as “maybe the greatest win in this program’s history.”
The Aggies are in the Mountain West Conference Mountain Division driver’s seat.
“It’s huge; I’ll make no bones about it. We’ve been saying it out of respect for Boise State, that the road to the Mountain West championship goes through them. Until someone knocks them off the throne, it’s theirs,” Wells said. “It isn’t the championship, but it puts us in the driver’s seat. We’ll control our own destiny and that will be a challenge. It’s a challenge our guys will gladly accept.”
